alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 06 at 12:32PM AKST until January 07 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 to 40 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 20 inches or higher possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Upper Lynn Canal including Haines, Skagway, the Haines Highway, and the South Klondike Highway. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon AKST Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Saturday evening through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Slippery conditions will develop. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Amounts are uncertain at this time, but could be higher than the 7 to 20 inches forecasted due to faster arrival of snow or longer duration of the cold air. Wet and heavy snow could challenge roof-tops, decks, and boats with extremely heavy loads. Pay close attention to your local avalanche forecast especially for those near steep terrain. With possible rain over a deep snowpack next week, flooding is also an increasing concern.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
